tool_description: Identifies and removes duplicate contact records by comparing names, email addresses, phone numbers, and other identifying information using fuzzy matching algorithms.

contact_records.description: Array of contact record strings to analyze for duplicates

matching_fields.description: Fields to use for matching: name, email, phone, address, company

keep_strategy.description: Strategy for keeping records: first, last, most_complete, or highest_quality

fuzzy_matching.description: Whether to enable fuzzy string matching

output_duplicates.description: Whether to include duplicate records in output

merge_fields.description: Whether to merge fields from duplicate records

min_record_quality.description: Minimum quality score to keep a record (0.0-1.0)

batch_size.description: Number of records to process in each batch (100-5000)

error_messages: Insufficient contact records: Provide at least 2 contact records for duplicate detection.
Too many contact records: Maximum 10000 contact records allowed per request.
Invalid similarity threshold: Value must be between 0.1 and 1.0.
Invalid matching fields: Use valid options from [name, email, phone, address, company].
Invalid keep strategy: Use one of [first, last, most_complete, highest_quality].
Invalid min_record_quality: Value must be between 0.0 and 1.0.
Invalid batch_size: Value must be between 100 and 5000.
Malformed contact records: One or more contact records could not be parsed.
usage: Provide contact_records array and optionally configure similarity_threshold, matching_fields, keep_strategy, and other parameters for customized duplicate detection and removal.

unique_contacts.description: Array of unique contact records after deduplication

original_count.description: Number of original contact records processed

unique_count.description: Number of unique contacts after deduplication
